page.title: 19STOKE GOLDINGTON HISTORY
page.content: Stoke Goldington takes its name from stockades,stakes stuck into the ground making pens for livestocks.Stoke Goldington lies between two main towns, one in Bucks Newport Pagnell, and Northampton in Northants.This picturesque village comprises old buildings with an interesting history, with a main road cutting through the village.The original village was by the church.The new village developed down the hill when the plague came.The Hollow Tree Restaurant is the oldest buiding in Stoke Goldington built in 1510 as a farm,later it became a pub then a restaurant.Todays post office -cum - grocery store was built in 1645. One lane,Tap Lane was once used by a brewery.Other out buildings are being redeveloped for housing.
